page.title: 05HIGH STREET,HIGH WYCOMBE.
page.content: The{High Street}was the{main road between{London and Oxford}but it is not so now. High Wycombe became an important{coaching stage,}being one day's journey from both{London and {Oxford. Inns}sprang up along the High Street where travellers and horses could rest. Only{Falcon Inn}at the Western end of High Street remains. The{Red Lion Hotel}has been demolished to make way for the{Woolworth Store, {The Three Tuns}public house remains but recently, the{Co-op}store has become a{McDonalds Take-away.}There are four{banks,}numerous{Building {Soicieties, travel agents}and a few small shops. Western end of the High Street is the{Parish Church of All {Saints.}On Fridays and Saturdays a street{market}is held in the High Street, which dates from very ancient times.
